intro: Psychotria viridibractea, commonly known as the green bract psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, yellowish fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous substance. Psychotria viridibractea is often found in shaded understory environments and is known for its ecological importance in supporting various insect and bird species.
